definition: lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
ordinary/to use
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
self/oneself/from/since/naturally/surely
to disturb

sentences.english: In fact, most people don't complain frivolously.
sentences.chinese: 事實上，很少人會“庸人自擾”。

sentences.english: It was much ado about nothing.
I would tell myself not to think of it any more.
sentences.chinese: 我會告訴自己，不要再庸人自擾了。

sentences.english: She fusses too much about her health.
sentences.chinese: 她對她的健康有點庸人自擾。

definition: spilt water is difficult to retrieve (idiom)/it's no use crying over spilt milk/what's done is done and can't be reversed/the damage is done/once divorced, there's no reuniting
to correct an error
lit. one body two sides (idiom)/fig. a situation with two sides to it
to force someone to do something
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to bear grudges
fickle in love/sentimentality
satisfied just to get through (idiom); to muddle through/without high ambitions, but getting by
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
to ask for trouble (idiom)/to make a rod for one's own back
paying more attention to a lover than friends (idiom)/to value sex over friendship
to think for oneself and act accordingly (idiom); to act on one's own initiative
one's own wishful thinking
